head.title: Plane Strikes Trees At End of Runway

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New Jersey
Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: Plane Strikes Trees At End of Runway

abstract.p: Rented single-engine plane is hit by tail wind and crashes into trees at end of runway during landing attempt at Sky Manor Airport, Alexandia Township, NJ; pilot, Oscar Mendez, and passengers Polanco Danilo and Christian Vanegas are slightly injured; third passenger is not hurt; plane is heavily damaged (S)

block.p: A single-engine plane was hit by a tail wind and crashed into trees at the end of a runway yesterday morning, the State Police said.

The pilot and two of the three passengers were slightly injured and the rented plane incurred heavy damage when it crashed at Sky Manor Airport in rural Alexandia Township, Hunterdon County, said Sgt. Daniel Cosgrove, a spokesman for the State Police.
A single-engine plane was hit by a tail wind and crashed into trees at the end of a runway yesterday morning, the State Police said.

The pilot and two of the three passengers were slightly injured and the rented plane incurred heavy damage when it crashed at Sky Manor Airport in rural Alexandia Township, Hunterdon County, said Sgt. Daniel Cosgrove, a spokesman for the State Police.

The pilot, Oscar Mendez, 30, of Brooklyn, suffered bruises and a cut on the head, and two passengers, Polanco Danilo, 21, of Brooklyn, and Christian Vanegas, 19, of Woodside, Queens, both had lower back injuries. A third passenger, Antonio Rodriguez, 31, of Brooklyn, was not hurt.
Mr. Mendez, said the tail wind forced him to abort his first landing attempt, and that he tried to abort a second attempt, but was unable to gain enough altitude to clear the trees.
